oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1959-04-25 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from April 25, 1959. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Porter Wagoner (host/performer), guest performer Skeeter Davis (although Elton Britt was advertised as the guest for this week on the previous show), and regular performers the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Hank Garland, Archie Campbell, and Grandpa Jones. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1020th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Porter Wagoner; Jordanaires; Skeeter Davis; Tommy Jackson; Hank Garland
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Porter Wagoner -- Tell Her Lies And Feed Her Candy (Porter Wagoner) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Porter Wagoner) -- Porter Wagoner introduces the Jordanaires -- Dip Your Fingers In Some Water (Jordanaires) -- Porter Wagoner introduces Skeeter Davis -- I Forgot More Than You'll Ever Know (Skeeter Davis) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Porter Wagoner) -- Porter Wagoner introduces Tommy Jackson -- Tennessee Wagoner (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Porter Wagoner and Grant Turner talk -- What Would You Do (If Jesus Came To Your House) (Porter Wagoner) -- Porter Wagoner introduces Hank Garland -- Fireball Mail (Hank Garland)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Garland, Hank, 1930-2004; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Jackson, Tommy; Jordanaires (Musical group); Campbell, Archie; Sloan, Ralph; Tennessee Travelers; Wagoner, Porter; Davis, Skeeter
